docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For weeks the results of a major new study on aspirin's ability to prevent heart disease were known by many scientists, government officials, business leaders and journalists.

headline.main: Medical Guardians; Aspirin Report Illustrates the Control of New England Journal on Data Flow

docs.snippet: LEAD: For weeks the results of a major new study on aspirin's ability to prevent heart disease were known by many scientists, government officials, business leaders and journalists.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: MEDICAL researchers have begun experimenting with synthetic hormones that effectively block harmful body secretions, an approach they hope will lead to the better treatments for many common diseases. In the case of some cancers, the new approach may even eliminate the need for surgery.

byline.original: By ROBIN MARANTZ HENIG; Robin Marantz Henig is a Washington-based medical writer whose books include ''How A Woman Ages.''

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ANDY WARHOL HATED hospitals, so when the pain in his upper abdomen came on, he turned to his chiropractor-nutritionist. The pain persisted, and a specialist who gave the 58-year-old Pop artist collagen injections for smoothing face wrinkles urged him to see an internist.
